replies.body: Jayce  has a very cowardly playstyle.

There is like 1 combo and 1 ability on top of that that is arguably cowardly. But Jayce requires a ton of skill and coordination to play well.

I mean are you going to tell me you've never seen a Jayce outplay anyone proactively? Never seen him jump at someone and completely destroy them?

Shaco is a coward. Rengar is a coward. Kha'Zix is a coward. Akali is a coward. Fizz is a coward. Ahri is a coward.

Wanna know why? Single abilities or effects that negate the opponent's entire kit either temporarily or make it extremely hard to use on them.

Jayce doesn't restrict his opponent. He is a relatively telegraphed champion by comparison to those i listed.
He just knocks them away and  runs if he misjudges the amount of poke he has to deliver before his all in.

Yeah. That is the one ability that is the only dishonorable thing but it's not like it's an OP ability. A lot of ways to work around it and it's not something like Shaco's Q that is a straight up flash with Invisibility that last for 5 seconds.

Actually try to understand my point.

I get your point. It just  doesn't negate my original  comment. 


Honestly riot has  overly incentived  cowardice under the label LCS Big Plays

Jayce main here with 4k+ games on him and been to diamond on multiple accounts.

>He just knocks them away and runs if he misjudges the amount of poke he has to deliver before his all in.

First of all, if you're a low elo player or you just dont know how jayce works, youre supposed to go up to him in aa form, then when he Es you away you use your mobility to get back up to him. Secondly, Jayce's E is on a 16 second cooldown until Jayce's start leveling it, which they dont do until about lvl 14.  If a Camille uses her E (Hookshot) to engage the Jayce, shes really screwing herself over that trade unless shes going in to ult. Camille should be engaging head first, then she uses E after Jayce uses his E. 

Also Jayce isnt a "Big Play" champion. He plays pretty bleh now due to no armor runes, Dorans Shield, heals, Resolve, and Corruption Potion + Time Warp abusers. Thats why Jayce is so bad in the top lane now is because when he goes to harass, he takes minion aggro and takes more damage than before. While the enemy that has dorans shield and or resolve basically negates any damage he deals with his autos compared to before. Junglers that gank Jayce is almost a guarantee win as well due to Jayce's lack of cc, squishyness, and mobility. 

>Honestly riot has overly incentived cowardice

Almost every champion in Season 8 is cowardly at the moment, so I dont understand what youre coming at here. In a season where people can get 100-0 at level 4, no wonder they play cowardly. Look at Sion, is behind and cant kill? Just ult away and youre good. Jax and behind? Just hop to a minion behind you and helicopter out. Jax and fed? Just hop to the enemy helicopter and 3 autos he dead. Wu and behind? Dash away with invisibility. Akali and behind? Shroud going invisible and wait for your jungler to come. You get the point.

> [{quoted}](name=JAAAAAAAAAAAAYCE,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=YhEnjbpj,comment-id=000100000001000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-29T07:41:19.109+0000)
>
> when he Es you away you use your mobility to get back up to him.


Reminder that you're talking to a mordekaiser main.

In that case you either 

A. Use your shield to cheese the Jayce when he all ins (I know from personal experience).
B. Build Doran's shield/Resolve and farm till you get Ninja Tabis and Rylais. If you dont die pre-6, you cant 100% 1v1 him from there on.

Gameplay-wise i dont have an issue with Jayce for the most part. 
I know when hes weak and when i should all in him. 
This is  M&G,s however   and im having a bit of a laugh at his expense.  
I think he is  fine as champions go even if he is played cowardly.
Feelszeroccormobilityman

> [{quoted}](name=LightTrack,realm=EUW,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=YhEnjbpj,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2018-10-29T03:18:33.599+0000)
>
> There is like 1 combo and 1 ability on top of that that is arguably cowardly. But Jayce requires a ton of skill and coordination to play well.
> 
> I mean are you going to tell me you've never seen a Jayce outplay anyone proactively? Never seen him jump at someone and completely destroy them?
> 
> Shaco is a coward. Rengar is a coward. Kha'Zix is a coward. Akali is a coward. Fizz is a coward. Ahri is a coward.
> 
> Wanna know why? Single abilities or effects that negate the opponent's entire kit either temporarily or make it extremely hard to use on them.
> 
> Jayce doesn't restrict his opponent. He is a relatively telegraphed champion by comparison to those i listed.

use hammer e, lul.
That "lul" was just the icing on the stereotype.

https://i.gyazo.com/3fb705b8fbc991b3f76ad68ba887da04.png

I believe you mean "fighting dirty" or "being tactical".

Besides, how is his knockback not a restriction for his foes? If you close the gap as any melee, he just knocks you back and goes back to outranging you.

I didn't say he was stupid. I said he's a coward. Don't use google to counter my points. It's like you're looking up the definitions, written down by other people because you can't come up with an explanation yourself. An AI didn't create these nor did God.

As for the second part, that is like saying "How is X champion not restricting you? They kill you and you're dead. Totally broken!"

I don't want to talk to you. Seriously. Goodbye.

Now this is some top notch irony.

I don't recall saying you ever said any champion was stupid. Besides, linking you the definition of a word from a dictionary is called a "source" and is not because I can't explain the word to you myself :)
Sources are often more effective than simply coming up with words yourself, or in some cases people would even refer to them as "facts" rather than opinions.

And you are totally right my friend; claiming that a champion restricts your gameplay, because they can outrange you, and maintain that gap between you with a knockback and high movement speed, is exactly like saying somebody restricts you because they kill you and you're dead.

What an excellent comparison.

Using a condescending attitude and trying to belittle me with it does not hide the bs you're spewing.

Confirmation bias. I'm not sure if you even know what i said.

> [{quoted}](name=LightTrack,realm=EUW,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=YhEnjbpj,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2018-10-29T03:18:33.599+0000)
>
> There is like 1 combo and 1 ability on top of that that is arguably cowardly. But Jayce requires a ton of skill and coordination to play well.
> 
> I mean are you going to tell me you've never seen a Jayce outplay anyone proactively? Never seen him jump at someone and completely destroy them?
> 
> Shaco is a coward. Rengar is a coward. Kha'Zix is a coward. Akali is a coward. Fizz is a coward. Ahri is a coward.
> 
> Wanna know why? Single abilities or effects that negate the opponent's entire kit either temporarily or make it extremely hard to use on them.
> 
> Jayce doesn't restrict his opponent. He is a relatively telegraphed champion by comparison to those i listed.

Shaco, Rengar, Kha'zix aren't coward, especially in team fights. However Akali I agree with you she isn't the same risk taking mistake-punishing and skill expressive champ she used to be.

Shaco's toolset:
- Does more damage when stabbing someone from behind.
- A long duration camouflage with built-in free flash on a short cooldown.
- A box that applies hard cc and can turn a fight uneven. Is commonly used for a safe escape path.
- A dagger for hit & run strategies. It's point and click too.
- An ultimate that can turn a fight into a 2v1. Also punishes the opponent for killing it succesfully by applying extra damage.

Shaco is a coward. The biggest one in the game.

Now Rengar. His abilities work at the same time. He will spam passive like a retard without giving much counterplay against it. If he has enough damage, you can't outplay him anyhow else except outrunning him.

Kha'Zix? Same thing. If he uses his ultimate correctly, you'll never see him coming and you're screwed with no chance to escape because his Q does most of his damage anyway.

> Shaco is a coward.

AKCHULY. Shaco has to be right in the face of danger to deal any sort of meaningful damage, then he has to escape after killing his target like a normal assassin. Coward from definition means someone who lacks courage in danger, pain, difficulty etc. So therefore, Shaco is N O T a coward!

Yeah because walking up to someone with an arsenal of escape tools and a literal box of toys to go along that is "facing danger".

That is like saying i'm brave for walking up to a group of black guys and yelling the N-word instead of being stupid.

The difference depends on who you ask. Both are right at the same time in their own way but Shaco is most certainly a complete fucking abomination. His kit is like if Singed was a caster mage.

Ok so first of all, you mention that he has an arsenal of escape tools, that is correct but did you ever consider how they work? His box takes 2 whole seconds to arm and can be disabled by oracles, control wards and duskblade and they can be oneshot by smite, graves level 1 auto attack, and any champ mid-late game. My Q late game has about a 9 second cooldown with cdr and goes down to about 6.50 seconds if i attack an enemy within 0.25 seconds of exiting stealth, again, oracles reveals me and Ignite gives true sight, turrets give true sight, lee sin gives true sight and many other champs have true sight too. The only other escape I can think of is my clone slowing the enemy with my E passive while I run for my life, or my clone dies and leaves boxes behind which fear the enemy if they continue to chase me. But you were missing the point of the comment I made, I have to use my escape tools to get into melee range which is already bravery, and try to kill them and proceed to run, because it's all I have left when I finish my combo, I would have to run for a full 6.50 seconds without dying or being cc'd till I can Q away to safety.

Yes because everyone has to pour time and money into building tools that disable other options for counterplay completely just to counter some champion's base ability. Another case of this kind of design is Akali's W, except she can't even be targeted. Rip Pantheon.

People below Plat IV will not do this, and this champion will ruin everyone's day when a decent player is using him for free elo.

And why would you put a wall of text full of .5 second timers and hypothetical scenarios? None of that applies to everyone as you're speaking from personal experience.

The confirmation bias is strong here.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RHQGqxOyMFk ~ http://www.lol-wallpapers.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Forsaken-Jayce-by-Platna-HD-Wallpaper-Fan-Art-Artwork-League-of-Legends-lol.jpg

Meanwhile, Tryndamere...

Some say he got the best kit in the game...for running away.
what else are you gonna do against urgot, irelia, and aatrox

Were just gonna have to give him some ~~Freedom~~ COURAGE! {{champion:240}} 
ALL IN OR NOTHING COWARD!
Jayce is a billion times better than Camille.

> [{quoted}](name=destroyer22719,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=YhEnjbpj,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-10-28T22:44:50.796+0000)
>
> You need to get your brain checked.

You can meme all you want about "DUH JAYCE IS SO BROKEN HURR DURR" but when you look into it, Jayce is very much weaker than Camille.

1. He has no keystones that are inherently good on him.

2. Almost all of his poke, which is not only his major strength but also the only thing he has going for him, can be negated by the enemy laner taking Doran's Shield + Second Wind.

3. Said poke can also be blocked by minions and costs a lot of mana if Jayce keeps spamming it.

4. He barely has a passive.

5. His dash requires a target, meaning he can't jump walls with it.

6. His Hammer W barely does anything beyond a passive mana restore.

7. Incredibly high cooldowns for someone that's supposed to consistently poke down the enemy.

8. Once a Bruiser or Juggernaut gets into melee range he's done for as he has no defensive spells beyond a knockback.

9. He barely has item customization as he doesn't synergize with a lot of items and is almost always relegated to build Armor Pen for his poke to deal any damage.

10. Said focus on Armor Pen leaves him incredibly squishy and it's almost suicide to go into Hammer mode in a teamfight.

Now what does Camille have going for her?

1. At least four Keystones that are good on her (Press the Attack, Conqueror, Electrocute and Arcane Comet).

2. **A free 20% maximum health shield on engage** that chooses exactly what shield would benefit her the most in that situation.

3. Not one, but **TWO Auto Attack resets** that give bonus range, free movement speed and the second one **deals double the amount of damage and 40 - 100% of it is converted into TRUE DAMAGE.**

4. AOE that cannot be blocked by minions, heals her, slows the enemy, and deals **percentage maximum health physical damage.**

5. **TWO DASHES,** the first one having a range of 800 units and doesn't require a target, and the second one having the same range towards enemy champions, **stuns the first target hit, and grants her an Attack Speed steroid.**

6. An ult that gives her **untargetability** as well as being one of if not the best lockdown tool in the game, as it creates **impassable terrain** that cannot be exit. Did I mention it also gives Camille's basic attacks **percentage health magic damage?**

7. Incredible item customization. She synergizes extremely well with Trinity Force and it is her core item. She can build a wide variety of both offensive and defensive items, since he's going to deal a truckload of damage either way with her true damage as well as two different sources of percentage health damage.

8. Said flexible item customization along with her free passive shield gives her incredible survivability and she almost becomes a pseudo-Tank with how hard she can be to kill.

9. Literally her only counterplay is "Just CC her".

But sure, let's meme about how unfair Jayce is with his negligible poke and only 2/3rds of his kit **actually doing something noticeable.**
You knew a lot more about Jayce than I thought you would. All the points you made about him are exactly right. Id like to add that his team fight is really garbage compared to a camille.

You can blow her up or evade Camille's shit. Or, yes, CC her.

Jayce is just going to snipe your ADC at 60% health from a mile away, because you can't reasonably ward every location he's able to get you from and he can just Duskblade your shit.

Also Jayce's poke can be negated by Second Wind and Doran's Shield? How tf is regaining 2% of my health going to do shit against his 40% EQ? His Q alone does *way* more than what you'll recover from those two. Even throwing {{item:3211}} and {{item:3065}} on top of that isn't going to give you *close* to half his Q's damage.

Sure, you can evade it, but it's fast as fuck with minimal warning and huge range (EQ, that is, not just Q), so it's really just a matter of time before he hits you with it and takes a huge chunk of your health away.

> [{quoted}](name=DuskDaUmbreon,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=YhEnjbpj,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-29T08:26:38.873+0000)
>
> You can blow her up

Blow her up? Good luck doing that through her:

1. Bone Plating.

2. 3000+ total health through Trinity Force, Sterak's Gage and Titanic Hydra.

3. 20% maximum health shield.

4. Aforementioned Sterak's Gage giving her another shield on top of her shield.

5. In dire situations, she can use her 1200 range E to disengage.

If she gets a Guardian's Angel later on, good luck.

>  or evade Camille's shit.

Half of Camille's kit are point and click. You can't evade her double the damage 100% converted into true damage auto attack reset that gives her bonus auto attack range and a movement speed buff.

What you can evade is her W and E.

W is very hard to evade unless you have a dash in your kit, especially considering Camille's movement speed buff on Q, and I don't know about you but it's just as hard to dodge a Camille E as it is to dodge a Jayce E + Q.

Not to mention, Camille's can change direction in a split second and has 400+ units more range whereas Jayce's always continues in a straight line and has a shorter range.

> 
> Jayce is just going to snipe your ADC at 60% health from a mile away, because you can't reasonably ward every location he's able to get you from

Sure, Jayce can deal around 60% health from "a mile away", but that's it.

It's the rarest of situations where you can actually kill someone off of your E + Q alone.

Besides, he might get you for 60% health but you have at least 4 seconds to run before he actually comes anywhere close.

You can't shoot someone from a mile away and then also close that distance in a shorter amount of time than they can react.

> and he can just Duskblade your shit.

HAH.

If that ADC has any kind of peel nearby, Jayce isn't going to do shit.

If that ADC is going alone, it's their own fault.

> 
> Also Jayce's poke can be negated by Second Wind and Doran's Shield? How tf is regaining 2% of my health going to do shit against his 40% EQ?

First off, it was hyperbole.

I didn't mean it's COMPLETELY negated, just that it cripples it.

Second off, you underestimating how much Doran's + Second Wind heals for.

Let's say you have 1000 hp, and Jayce just did 200 of it in one E + Q (calculated after Armor).

Let's say you have 10 base health regen, meaning you regenerate 10 health over 5 seconds.

Doran's Shield gives you an extra 6 HP over 5 seconds, meaning we're now up to 16 HP over 5 seconds.

You heal for an additional 20 health over 10 seconds (10 health over 5 seconds) when taking damage.

Second Wind gives you an extra flat 6 + 4% of missing health over 10 seconds. (3 + 2% of missing health over 5 seconds).

Missing health in this case is 200, and 4% of that is 8.

That means, in total over 10 seconds, you would've regenerated 64 health over 10 seconds, over a quarter of the damage he just dealt.

Chug a health potion (150 HP) and you've now healed for OVER the damage he dealt.

And by the way, no Jayce E + Q deals 40% HP in the laning phase.

> His Q alone does *way* more than what you'll recover from those two.

Sure, if you have no Armor.

> Even throwing {{item:3211}} and {{item:3065}} on top of that isn't going to give you *close* to half his Q's damage.

You'd probably be better off buying Armor to reduce the initial damage anyway.

> 
> Sure, you can evade it, but it's fast as fuck with minimal warning and huge range (EQ, that is, not just Q),

Oh, you mean like Camille E?

> so it's really just a matter of time before he hits you with it and takes a huge chunk of your health away.

And that's basically his only strength.

He takes a chunk of your health and then nothing else.

He's probably not going to kill you unless you walk into him or you are alone.
i dont think you understand this post

10/10 game design if you ask me.

> So original for a "defender of tomorrow".

Yeah that title really doesn't fit all that much.

Let's give him a shield.
https://i.imgur.com/y8ODp4e.png#noredirect

Jayce is that rich kid who thinks he is gangsta because he dresses and tries to talk like one.

We all know what Jayce really is. A wannabe melee champion who paid rito off to give him melee champion stats and abilities even though he spends most of his time in ranged mode.

Fuck you Jayce.

When I see Jayce picked I think one of two think : "I sure hope mid/jungle/bot knows how to deep ward so I can impact with those TP plays" or "I guess I'll play Touhou on easy mode while farming"

Legit Jayce is just annoying, he's almost on the same level as Teemo for me, just an annoyance, not really a danger.

And I'm not saying "I'm so cool Jayce is my bitch xdddd", Jayce is a lane bully, it's annoying and if you mess up you can get yourself killed pretty easily but don't stress about it, take it easy and wait for your time to shine, either in Teamfight/skirmish or the right time to show him you shouldn't get to close, science boy.

> [{quoted}](name=Saitho Orihara,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=YhEnjbpj,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2018-10-29T03:53:48.051+0000)

Jayce is more annoying than Teemo because Teemo has good counters. Jayce on the other hand has nobody except {{champion:80}} to match early laning phase. {{champion:39}} needs to hit lvl 3 in this scenario to withstand jayce burst. {{champion:164}} early game W doesn't heal and her passive isn't big enough. Teemo on the other hand can be countered easily by assassins and divers and man more.
Her face is so perfect for this meme.

I am fine with a Jayce, as you can dodge his Q's and fight him when he is in melee form

However, I am not fine with a LETHALITY Jayce, who can press W in ranged form and chunk you for 1/3 of your hp each time you try to farm

I prefer playing Jayce more than Camille tho

Correction : Against Jayce ** , I meants againsy Jayce, I don't play both but I prefer playing against Jayce more
That makes you a terrible person.

As an ARAM OTP, I'll play Jayce over Camille everytime.

I can play both forms reasonably well, much the same as Nidalee, but unlike Jayce, I don't understand how Camille works at all.

That said, I have had my head kicked in more than once by a good Camille - I nuke her, and she gets her AD shield; I switch to hammer time, trying to nail her, and she ults me.

>https://pics.me.me/none-of-you-seem-to-understand-im-not-locked-in-11681735.png ~ {{champion:164}}

It's one of those "I know what she can do when I play against her, but no idea when I play as her"-champions. :/

You're an ARAM player, and like fighting Jayce over Camille...?

You like fighting the guy who's going to repeatedly chunk your team instead of the bitch who's borderline useless in the mode?

You may want to read that again.

For Clarity™, the subject was "play _as_ Jayce against Camille" - not the opposite. :)
